page.title: 01THE WOLDS
page.content:
The countryside is mainly rolling wolds in agricultural use. In the shallow valleys are small attractive villages including{Wymeswold, Hoton, {Burton-on-the-Wolds,}and{Prestwold.
{Burton-on-the-Wolds}lies in a shallow hollow giving the impression of compactness. It is centred on the Melton Road/Barrow Road junction. Much infilling of the old village pattern has taken place in the last twenty years. 32 houses built before 1939, 130 built since. The older cottages are brick with slate roofs; 2 of Swithland slate. All but 12 of the newer houses are detached, brick with tile roofs. 1 pub, 1 garage, 2 shops, 1 chapel, 1 village hall, 3 industrial sites.
